intro: Descurainia incana var. macrosperma, commonly known as hoary tickseed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its gray-green, fuzzy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Its seeds are small and elongated, contributing to its ability to spread easily in open environments.
